title: Lumos
summary: Manage Wear brightness in one click
description: Changing the brightness on Android Wear can be a pain, so we created Lumos! This first release allows you to literally start brightness on your wrist and select the desired brightness with a couple of taps. For maximum or minimum brightness, simply press and hold. This project is totally free and open source. Who is behind Lumos? • UX Designer: Kim Does [http://kimdoesdesign.nl/] • Graphic Designers: Lydia Selimalhigazi [https://www.behance.net/LysDesign] and Caroline Smith [https://dribbble.com/ihatepeas]• Developer: Roberto Orgiu [https://github.com/tiwiz]
descriptionHTML:
Changing the brightness on Android Wear can be a pain, so we created Lumos!

This first release allows you to literally start brightness on your wrist and select the desired brightness with a couple of taps. For maximum or minimum brightness, simply press and hold.

This project is totally free and open source.

Who is behind Lumos?
• UX Designer: Kim Does [http://kimdoesdesign.nl/]
• Graphic Designers: Lydia Selimalhigazi [https://www.behance.net/LysDesign] and Caroline Smith [https://dribbble.com/ihatepeas]
• Developer: Roberto Orgiu [https://github.com/tiwiz]
comments: Did not work on my 1st gen Moto 360 Tapped the up & down buttons but nothing happened right away. Display did get darker, but not as I pressed the buttons. Too inconsistent.
